>
>John, Timmy,
>
>I suppose it depends on the implementation but keeping track of ALL
>innovations might become cumbersome during a long run. Perhaps then you
>could keep track of a fixed number of innovations. Old innovation
>records will be discarded as new ones are inserted into the table,
>effectively creating a First-In/First-Out buffer of innovation records.

Presumably an innovation record can be discarded once no living individuals 
contain it?
Then the unique number could also be reused, if required....

         Ian Badcoe
